website_summaries.verdict: A well-made tool by a top name in the industry with features and design that can tackle most mid-level tasks.
cons: Pricey, and the battery and charger must be purchased separately
Suction is less powerful when operated by battery

customer_reviews.title: Thing Sucks and not in the way you expect.
customer_reviews.text: This is the poorest excuse of a vacuum cleaner I have ever seen. It has so little suction, you find yourself rubbing the end of your hose against the carpet trying to get it to work. Eventually you are beating your hose on the rug, praying you don't break it, while trying get it to pick up something In the end, you go get your house vacuum to do the job knowing it is only slightly better. But at least you don't have to beat your hose on the carpet. It's cute. It looks like it should be a vacuum. it's not lightweight. And it is not useful
customer_reviews.author: nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less then 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I used the to clean up the cars and other light cleaning duties maybe once a week. It no longer powers on either on battery or plugged in. Tried using the chat for support, first time the "website was not found". Tried again latter and sat waiting "Please hold while we connect you to an agent." for over 45 min. Their phone support is only available why i'm at work, and there is no other support that I can find.
customer_reviews.author: 4pierre

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered.  Really Bad Battery Life.
customer_reviews.text: The suction power is average at best. On a fully charged battery you will get 5-7 minutes before it starts slowly winding down. Unless you have a stable of batteries ready you will be using this plugged in. However, I am still giving it 3 stars because I have 2 of the 20vMAX batteries and that gives me around 10-12 minutes of full power vacuuming to clean my storm shelter out every few weeks which is why I bought the thing. Stay away if you are wanting top notch power and long battery life. It just wasn't designed for that.
customer_reviews.author: AmericanFight

customer_reviews.title: Fails to work with battery.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received intermittently stopped working with the battery. I got a replacement and after 3 months, it stopped working with the battery entierly and only worked plugged in. I have 2 new Dewalt batteries, so the problem is with the vac and not the batteries. Very disappointing to have two defective items in a row. My old Dewalt vac worked like a champ for over 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Dog lover

customer_reviews.title: No suction, battery dies
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this. So much so that I read all of the negative reviews and decided that if I used a 20V lithium battery it would work, I mean, it's DeWalt, right? Nope. Bought new batteries, fully charged them, then attempted to wetvac the boat after a rain. The battery died in 5 minutes. Went to empty the canister and there were 3 drops of water on the bottom, it should have been completely full. I am so bummed out about this because we need a cordless wetvac for our boat carpet, we store it in a shed that doesn't have electricity. Will keep looking...
customer_reviews.author: L Reisert

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this vacuum maybe 10 times since I received it and ALL for very minor household use. The hose fell apart today while I was vacuuming a rug. The glue that connected the hose just disintegrated. Conveniently, my return window closed a couple weeks ago and now I’m stuck with this piece of junk. All my tools are DeWalt, but based on the quality of this tool I think I’m going to have to change my brand loyalty. We have a cordless Milwaukee vacuum that we’ve had for well over a year and performs outstandingly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gryn

customer_reviews.title: Loses suction fast
customer_reviews.text: After just one month and three short uses, the motor is making barely any suction. I bought a brand new DeWalt filter to check that; it made no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Christian  Bailey

customer_reviews.title: This thing couldn't vacuum pixie dust!
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand how this weak unit got such a high rating. I did NOT buy this for heavy duty shop vac purposes. I simply wanted something to vacuum up sanding dust from trim before I painted. But it couldn't even do that effectively. I had one of it's predecessors I bought 10 years ago and that was good. But this? Shame on you, Dewalt. Did you even test it? If you can't vacuum up dust, then what CAN you do?
customer_reviews.author: Crosscheck67

customer_reviews.title: Junk.....
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a joke. Zero auction power whether battery or plugged in. If send it back if i hasn't gotten it all dusty. The overall rating of this is suspiciously high if you starting looking at the number of poor reviews. I'm a DeWalt fan and have bought their tools for years but they should be arranged of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: I recommend that nobody purchase this product for 18 v use
customer_reviews.text: The DeWalt 18v / 20 v-max doesn't work. Go ahead and insert your 18 v battery into the battery bay. Everything will work as expected until you attempt to remove the 18 v battery. There is very little clearance in the battery bay for you fingers. And as a result, the 18 v battery is impossible to remove by hand. I ultimately used two pry bars to simultaneously leverage my battery out - at which time it went skidding across my concrete garage floor. I recommend that nobody purchase this product for 18 v use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't last, warranty is not consumer friendly
customer_reviews.text: Moderate power for normal use. I have used this vacuum for about a year and the motor has completely failed. Won't turn on and no matter what I have tried. Called dewalt and was told to take it to repair facility, more than an hour away.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Horgn

customer_reviews.title: Cordless feature doesn't last.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 3 weeks until the battery powered operation quit working. Still works with ac cord, but not immediately if it's cold out. Now I am stuck with a $115 plain ol shopvac. Oh and I can't get anyone to return emails for warranty return.
customer_reviews.author: Fuhler Fam

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, but weak
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly, packaged well. The vac works, and the battery power is convenient. The HEPA filter works well, nothing gets by, but with the small filter you don't get much air flow. I would love to see either a 60V version with a motor with more power, a different filter option for when you don't need the HEPA but more suction is priority, or a larger filter. It works well for very small area cleanups, but if you have anything heavy, damp, or spread out, you will be there a while. Nothing notable changes when plugged in vs battery powered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok. Could be designed better.
customer_reviews.text: Who puts the vacuum hose and the exhaust hole on the same side? DeWalt does that’s who. That way when you’re sweeping up your mess it’s blowing your mess further from you. It’s an apparent design flaw in my honest opinion. I own lots of DeWalt tools but this is not one I would rave about.
customer_reviews.author: Sean The Great

customer_reviews.title: Worst suction ever...almost a joke really
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum because it was portable and could use the batteries for dewalt tools I already had as well as a cord. It was also important to me that it had a HEPA filter. Long story short - suction power is ridiculously low. I can't believe that anyone designed this and thought it was even adequate. Totall ripoff really. I will probably gift mine to Goodwill and I have only used it maybe twice in the year since I have bought it. Like another reviewer said you will just end up using your regular house vac instead. I can only imaging that 99% of the reviews on this item are fake.
customer_reviews.author: Swamp Thing

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy battery function will fail
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for cleaning the truck and other interior carpentry projects ...after a year the batteries would not power the vacuum So now it’s a chitty little shop vac for 130$ . The service center on Oahu closed permanently telling us to call the s.s. In Salt Lake City How friggin ridiculous is that? EDIT:3/320 stopped working all together DONT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Needs more power
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea of a vacuum that is compatible with my Dewalt batteries. I have used it about 10 times now, and it is easy to carry and move around. My only complaint is that the suction is a little weak. I have not tried it via the cord, only cordless, which was the main reason for purchasing. Example, when sucking up litter that was kicked out of the cat box, it would suck it up, but had to have the nozzle directly on the litter.
customer_reviews.author: Bry

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of power, akward, needs corner suction tool.
customer_reviews.text: In general, love DEWALT everything. Not a big fan of this product. Got it for the car and small household projects. Not much suction, the junk free vacuums at the car wash measure up well against it. A bit heavy, hard to vacuum without putting the machine down in inconvenient locations, limited reach of the suction tube, and no corner suction tool. Fortunately, the tools for the household vacuum fit. Very difficult to get it into the bag for storage, and then you need to vacuum the bag when you take it out. Wish I'd hung onto my small corded vacuum instead of assuming this would work well. Planning on giving it a non-profit and getting another small corded vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: It isn't that powerful, and it isn't that loud ...
customer_reviews.text: It isn't that powerful, and it isn't that loud, but it gets the job done. It's important to eventually buy a battery and charger (this thing doesn't charge, expected). It makes it a lot more convenient, even my wife uses this now. The Dyson Home Cleaning Kit (ASIN B002OHKLJW) has a 1 1/4 inch friction receptacle to Dyson locking connector so if you are tired of low quality brushes, and you already have a Dyson + cleaning kit, you just saved some money. I just realized this as I was about to check out some junk 1 1/4 inch brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Anti-climatic
customer_reviews.text: Biggest disappointment of the year. Love DEWALT but hands down the worst portable vacuum on the planet. $120 vacuum with a $5 suction power. I bought this for my car and didn't even tried it after plugging it in. My first thought was that the vacuum was broken but only thing that was broken was how this poor excuse of a vacuum even made it to the market.
customer_reviews.author: Solkillerexe

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, plus I found a unique use for it.
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well seeing that it is a portable battery model. It's easy to use and light enough to carry around. I even found a new use for it; I have a 50 foot row of potato plants in my garden and there were lots of Colorado potato beetles and larva on them. I tried a pesticide which didn't work very well do to their resistance, I used the vacuum to remove them and that worked well. After several times of doing that over a couple of weeks I now have pretty much eliminated them. They will be back though so I will need to remain diligent in vacuuming them up.
customer_reviews.author: Nhman111

customer_reviews.title: Still in the box
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it, it's the middle of the winter. I hope it's worth the 5 stars I gave it. UPDATE: I finally got my chance to use/try this and I'm glad I gave it 5 stars. I have a german shepherd and she loves to ride in my van and if you know anything about this type of dog then you know how bad they shed. They are in the top 5 of the most shedding dogs. Well, this vacuum worked great and picked up all her hair with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Willis

customer_reviews.title: Good suction, portable!
customer_reviews.text: This product surpassed my expectations. After reading through all the reviews, I thought that it wouldn't have that great of suction: I was wrong. This thing can really suck stuff up - from pennies to rocks and metal, I really could not notice the difference between this and a much larger shop vac. The batter aspect is great. I can take it out to my car and not have worry about an extension cord. The batter (6ah) seems to last a long time. Really handy, light even with the battery. All and all I am really impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Nathanielt

customer_reviews.title: This Product REALLY Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Whether using 120VAC or one of my DeWalt batteries, this little wet and dry vac if perfect for spot cleanups around a remodel site. Light enough to carry up a ladder, strong enough to pick up nuggets of drywall and wood chips. Greatly improves the task of cleanup at the end of a job. The addition of ShopVac wand extensions and a horsehair brush allow cleaning of fan blades, shutters, blinds, light fixtures, and other things around the job. Well worth the money and far better than a small "buster" type unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It Smoked
customer_reviews.text: It smoked up my kitchen & I unplugged it and returned the vac. I requested another just like it & it was terrible. No suction but the second didn't smoke, so I returned it and ask for a refund. Then I went to Lowe's & bought one there but a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: this I thought would be great for small trim jobs
customer_reviews.text: As many other carpenters,this makes shop vac #4,all various sizes, this I thought would be great for small trim jobs, and throw in my back seat, the convenience of battery, and corded use,I jumped on it, but it was a little disappointing when I turned it on,to check suction...which is why I rated it this way. Great for light saw dust, but still use my shop-vac brand ,when I need it cleaned. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle, expensive to repair
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine a couple of years ago, very lightweight and convenient for small jobs, when I take my screens off to wash windows it will pick up all that dirt, along baseboards but truly wanted it for the cars. If I go over the carpet many times it will clean it . The suction is not that great but it is easy to handle. Then the battery part quit working, bought a new battery, it is not the battery. So thought I would get it repaired $109.00 to repair. So I guess you can make up your own mind.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Oveheats battery, suction not so great
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum Causes the 3AH battery to overheat, which in turns shuts the vacuum off. Suction power not strong enough. provided hose is too short, requiring a user to lug the vacuum around.
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: The vacuum sucks well.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum sucks. About one of the only products on the market you can say that about and mean it in a good way. I have used to it both for wet and dry. Was able to suck out a lot of water that flooded an underground conduit. with one vacuum on the first end blowing into the pipe and the second vacuum on the other end sucking, it pulled so much water. It was impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Watt

customer_reviews.title: Product FAILED after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: purchased this thinking the combination 20V battery/110V AC would be great. WRONG. Product failed to operate on batt (tried 3 NEW 20V MAX) after 3 uses. After a short vacation, I returned to find the product failed to operate when plugged into 110V AC ( yes, I ck'd the outlet(s). Conveniently, all this happened AFTER the Amazon "Window" to return by days. I will buy my next one from HD as they have no such "Window". I have several Dewalt 20V MAX tools and all work well. Big disappointment. DO NOT BUY ONE OF THESE.
customer_reviews.author: mike c

customer_reviews.title: Sucks poorly(updated)
customer_reviews.text: It sucks would be too nice a review, plugged in or on battery it has no sucking at all. Changed to 5 stars, manufacturing problem left strands of glue in hose, when cleaned out fixed my problem
customer_reviews.author: P. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come with a battery, and you will want additional attachments, otherwise?  Great!
customer_reviews.text: For almost 200 bucks, it would have been nice to come with a battery. The one in the picture is one of the batteries I already have. It’s also about the size of your average house-cat... little bigger though. It’s small, and powerful, and runs off a cord OR battery, but it’s not as small as you would like it to be.... it’s kind of bulky in an odd way, and it’s kind of hard to use. I wish it came with attachments, but despite these criticisms, it’s an awesome little tool. Plenty of suction, EASY to clean, EASY to get and install new filters. Get yours today!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ishaq

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend finding another vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I have a deep appreciation for DeWalt tools normally. This vacuum has pretty weak suction, but i still found a purpose for it in my shop. Until the 4th time I used it and it just stopped turning over on AC power. So now I am trying to get DeWalt to honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson R Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to empty without making a mess...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this thing is a bit heavier than I expected, but it *is* portable. The problem comes when emptying it. You take off the top, containing the motor and all that gubbins, no problem. However, the bottom half, where the mess ends up, has a large lip all the way around. It is very difficult to tip it out over the lip without spilling a good bit of it back onto the floor. That kinda takes away from its versatility a bit...
customer_reviews.author: Phil Buglass

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Howling Noise
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of Dewalt tools that I've been very satisfied with over the years. I have high hopes for this vacuum because of its portability and that it uses 18 and 20 V batteries and 120V power. However, when the hoses extended past 40 inches the vacuum created a high pitched howling sound. This occurred on battery operation and on 120 V operation. I tried removing the filter to see if the change in resistance made a difference. It did not reduce the noise. I returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: fergie4011

customer_reviews.title: FIRST TRY
customer_reviews.text: So far, tried only once. Delayed buying an expensive battery to try on house current first. Used it to clean the bottom of a dry bird fountain before refilling fountain with water. Lots of cement dust and flakes and dirt. The unit is easy to carry. Connection to house current was no problem. Had to use short extension . No problems. Did very good job on first try of dry pickup.Poerful suction. Easy to clean up using house hose. Probably will not buy the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Sinyard

customer_reviews.title: Greatly improved! A necessary addition to any good tool collection
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the first generation dewalt vacuum, it is like comparing walking and driving. The new vacuum has more than doubled the total capacity of the vacuum, but the sucking power on battery feels infinitely higher. When a plug is convenient it does suck better, but not nearly as much as the difference between gen 1 and gen 2 on battery. The onboard tools are just a credit to the dewalt engineers. So happy to have this vacuum for the little messes, but it also is great for vacuuming the boat and car as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice little vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: An Excellent vac for quick clean up jobs. I you are in a spot where you need a vac for small spaces and hate looking for the plug or asking for a plug you will like this vac. It came with a cord but I hardly use it unless the battery goes dead. Good suction, (Not perfect) but does the job well so no complaints about it. Like the filter as well, very easy to knock in the can to get clean after use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Used this while remodeling the home. Love this thing! Yes I hear it isn't as powerful as the competitor but it fits all my Dewalt batteries and comes with a cord in case the battery dies. The attachment are nice and easy to get to and the hose has a decent extension. I def will be using this a lot around the house while remodeling/ repairs and very nice for cleaning up the car. Btw awesome that I can use the flexvolt batteries for longer usage.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good product but a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: Product does what it is supposed to do. However I do feel that it is a little overpriced. If this product lasts me for many many years to come then I will stop complaining about the price point. The suction is not that strong but strong enough to do most of your quick cleanup tasks. It is relatively lightweight which also nice. It also has a function to blow air out but do not expect this to have much inflation power.
customer_reviews.author: Primal Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great portability!
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum works great and has enough suction power to get the job done. I run it on a 3ah 20v battery and it lasts a couple weeks easily vacuuming wood chips in the basement every other day from hauling wood in. Works great for the car too.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very under powered, however works great for quick light cleanup such as sanding dust. Was very excited to purchase because we love dewalt and I needed something easy to haul around that was self contained for construction clean up and vehicle detailing...in a pinch its great to have around but if i can i will use my shopvac first (bummed)! If this had better stronger suction and if the battery would charge when it is plugged in and last longer it would for sure be my vacuum of choice
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for dust pickup, spider webs, crumbs; not for heavier debris.
customer_reviews.text: Nice form factor. Portability and dual power (ac or dc 18v-20v Dewalt battery pack) is convenient. Great for cleaning tents while camping, spider webs, dust bunnies, dry coffee grounds, etc. Doesn't do well with small drywall pieces, BB's, glass, etc. If price point was in the $50 range, then it'd be on par with its performance. Get an inverter and the 4-gallon size. If Dewalt could figure a way to get more suction out of this, then it'd be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevbo

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of running a cord to plug in shop vac to vacuum cars out. Works great for keeping car vacuumed and small jobs around the house. Havent had any problems out of it and it's been a few months since I bought it. I use the bigger battery 6 ah. I can fully vacuum 2 cars and still have 2 bars left on battery. You must clean filter out to keep good suction. I blow mine out with air hose.
customer_reviews.author: Troy P

customer_reviews.title: one of DeWalt's best ideas
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is AWESOME. I love the flexibility of being able to use its battery powered feature because my DeWalt power tool batteries are interchangeable. I honestly think it has MORE power when on battery power than when plugged into 120 volt house current. It comes with two attachments built in and its the IDEAL tool to clean the dirt, rocks, sawdust etc from my work truck. And, around the home its handy for cleaning up everything from spills and dirt etc.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: ITS good if you are running dewalt already, smaller in size would be better
customer_reviews.text: Im a dewalt carprnter, my kit is all 20v and 60v. this vac is just okay as for suction, its just okay. great for the cordless factor, just wish it had a more suction power and it was slightly smaller similar to the stinger size. Its too big to fit in my tool kit but still comes in handy at home, smaller and lighter would be better, make it into a square box size and make it to run on 20v and 60v batteries, this one is a older version, 18v is out now guys, dewalt get with the times, ill buy the next version and next time ill buy it with out a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but only two gallons? Could be more without too much trouble.
customer_reviews.text: This is strong enough on battery power alone to suck the water out of a three-foot deep, six-inch downdraft range exhaust pipe that fills up occasionally, and it does it FAST so it is powerful enough to have been designed for a little more capacity than only two gallons. I though about enlarging the reservoir but it'll be easier to empty it three or four times a few times a year than to take the chance of messing it up. Nobody would know whether one of the four-gallon reservoirs from the next A/C models up would fit, would they?
customer_reviews.author: MikeInWeston

customer_reviews.title: Love it, suggest it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, suggest it. You want to use the 20v battery the 18v drain to quickly. Therere a couple design flaws I'm surprised DeWalt did not address before putting on the market such as the hose tip is upside down so the entire hose has to twist in order the lay flush on a surface and when not in use hose easily pops off the clip that secures it in place. Honestly I expected the DeWalt name to have a user friendly quality higher than competitors. I give it five stars because of the excellent job it does (wet or dry). Very light or portability and easy use.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Love

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first big job - vacuuming out gutters for the winter after installation of a new composite roof. Ended up with about ten pounds of shingle nubbies in the bucket after about three hours of near continuous vacuuming. Went through two XR5 lithium ion batteries during the job and was very happy with the duration and the power. Not quite the suction of my full size shop vac, but plenty good for this job and a heck of a lot more portable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Daebelliehn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sucking up cat hair in a hardwood house.
customer_reviews.text: We have a very big house, hardwood floors, and four cats. Cat hair, especially in the summer, is constantly collecting in the corners. This cordless vac along with a couple of extension tubes from our "regular" corded vac, make staying ahead of the cat hair a very simple 10 minutes a day task. Have also used it to clean the cars and patio furniture. Works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: The AR

customer_reviews.title: Poor Suction
customer_reviews.text: Can not even pick up drywall dust when plugged in. This a kids toy not a pro tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Might power in a small shop vac
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use when I’m at clients offices and houses. It’s got a filter that stops the drywall dust. It can be powered off the battery or power cord. It also comes with a crevice tool. The dust collection bin is a bit hard to empty but it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Nsiddons

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this new style vac after my other cordless/corded ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new style vac after my other cordless/corded one died after 13 years. The older style served me well for using it for remodel after remodel. I can't say that the newer style has any more suction than the older one but the convenience alone makes up for not having to find an outlet to plug into. The new one has a weird fluctuation or power surge when turned on but doesn't happen all the time. 3 stars because of the power fluctuations.
customer_reviews.author: Krenovate

customer_reviews.title: Handiest thing
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing ask the time, first for cars (I have no garage) and projects. But it's so handy it's becoming my go-to. I purchased some additional brushes and extension wands suggested in the buy with which made it more useful. Look at the purchasers who suggest modifications-I'm going to install pvc to carry the wands as suggested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i love it
customer_reviews.text: this thing is very portable and its dual power, the suction is not that great its on par with smaller vacuums, its for small places and where you need a small vac. a large vac will always be superior to this, i use this for tight places and where power is not an option and for those jobs this is gold. everything else a large vac is what i use.
customer_reviews.author: blaster

customer_reviews.title: Strong. Suction could be a little stronger
customer_reviews.text: I took delivery the other day of this shop vac. Everything works very well. I used it to vacuum my car on a 20v battery. It did well. It’s not very noisy like other shop vacs. My only complaint is that the suction is not as strong as I hoped for. I get that it’s a smaller vacuum and therefore the suction is not like a big shop vac. I’ll also say that the suction is not all that bad either! It does well. I just wish it had a bit more. Hence the four star. I really like this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know if I would like it - and I love it
customer_reviews.text: Received as a Fathers day gift and was a bit skeptical. Turns out it is awesome, use it all the time in the shop and has been in the house for little messes with the kids more than anticipated. Ran on and off for several hours on 2 amp battery and had 2/3rds left on it! Perfect for cleaning out the car too... I will be buying one for my Dad for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Bjleau

customer_reviews.title: Great corded/cordless vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. Love it so much we bought another. I use mine all around the shop and my wife uses hers to vacuum her rabbit pens. Very good suction with the options of a cord or battery. Attachments are kept on board and easy to store. Uses the 20v and even the 60v batteries as well as the older 18v ones. Great product. Dewalt quality.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAndCyn

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed power toggle switch
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum, works well and is lightweight. Only reason I am giving it one star is because after 2 months of light use the power toggle switch broke and renders the vacuum useless. After contacting Dewalt the only solution was for me to ship the entire unit to a dewalt warranty service center. They would send a prepaid shipping label however, that process is an inconvenience. I requested they just send me a new switch but they said that would void the warranty. Overall the product functioned well but the poorly designed power switch and difficulty of dewalt providing me with a simple solution has left me with a poor review of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small oddjobs
customer_reviews.text: I work HVAC and use this as a wetvac for clean up and clearing drains. Not the most powerful, but when finding plugs is a problem this things great for short odd jobs. Not good for large cleanups or high vacuum. I don't bother trying to use it as a dryvac. Update:. After a lot of use and abuse, it finally smoked today. It was the same mosfet that another user posted pictures of, it seems to be a weak point in the design. Still handy for small odd jobs till it went.
customer_reviews.author: RB855

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks! (In a good way.)
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works just as well with the battery or plugged into the wall. Using the battery makes it very convenient. I had become accustomed to finding an outlet to clean up my messes; now I don't have to do so. Most of the time I am only cleaning up after I drill a hole and this is much easier than my previous shop vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie L Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't like anything about this vacuum I wish I had more time I would have returned it in a heartbeat...
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Not even 5 months in and it no longer works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Miles

customer_reviews.title: Good compact vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: The fact that it's battery powered and corded is awesome. Don't bother using a battery with less then a 4 amp hour. Tried using a 2 amp and it kills the battery fast. Using a 5 amp and it lasts a work week with intermittent use. The suction isn't great but is adequate with its portability. Down side is suction port and blower port are on the same side. So have to be aware when you turn it on and not blow everything away from unit. One feature that would be great, is when you use the cord it also doubles as a battery charger.
customer_reviews.author: Lance L

customer_reviews.title: Has no power for suction.
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work for what I need it for. Just has no suction power. Could work for cleaning cabinets after installing. Just not for Corian cutting or epoxy cutting. Power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Camou II

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really couldn't be much happier with this. For smaller projects, or for a Shop-Vac to keep inside the house rather than in the garage, it's amazing. Obviously this is not going to replace a bigger, more powerful shop vac, but as a lightweight alternative to the big vac? Just perfect. Surprisingly powerful performance considering it runs on battery.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.

customer_reviews.title: Compact size, battery powered or corded!
customer_reviews.text: Only used it a couple of times. And although it is not as powerful of a vac as a typical shop vac, it does clean up some of the dirt and dust left behind when I work. And best of all, it is real easy to use. I used to keep a broom and dustpan handy, but with this vac, it can do the same job plus handle wet stuff too. Love its compact size. And if my batteries are dead, I can always use the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is great for small spills
customer_reviews.text: This Vac is the handiest thing I have ever used. It is great for small spills, vacuuming out your car. blowing the dust from your computer and key board to clearing the dust off your work bench! It uses both 18v and 20v batteries and can be plugged into a 120v outlet. I also love the cleanable filter and the lightweight aspect of it. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Quality Products
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Very lightweight, easy to use and has good suction. Dual power option is nice, but I wanted it for cordless use. Used for hard-to-reach spots, pre-vac for spots floor vac can't quite reach. Cons: Hose is a bit short, wish exhaust was on any other side, tends to blow where you are trying to clean due to hose (intake) location. Overall{ Highly recommend, very useful around the house/car.
customer_reviews.author: E. E. Monday

customer_reviews.title: great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: It was good for smaller jobs. For example, drill a hole in drywall and the last thing you want to do is lug out a shopvac. This is perfect. So perfect in fact...mine was stolen within a week.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Usable
customer_reviews.text: Good for small jobs like vacuuming the car and small mess at the jobsite. Not recommended for jobs with lots of dust and water. The filter gets clogged easily and the suction power is not as powerful as I would want it. The good thing about it is that you can use a battery to run it and since I have a lot of dewalt tools it was convenient and there was no need in buying new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: FEE

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Im using this with 20 volt max batteries and love it! no the suction isn't the same as a 16 gallon shopvac, so don't go expecting it to suck at that level. This works great for quickly cleaning up messes. It's hard to say the total run time/battery since I am usually only using it a couple minutes at a time, but if I had to estimate I would say I get around 50 minutes or so.
customer_reviews.author: JD Fan

customer_reviews.title: Wimpy suction Lame that it doesn't charge when plugged in filters $$$
customer_reviews.text: When plugged in it does not charge, which is lame. Wimpy suction that drops quickly when the super expensive filter gets dirty. Runs through 20v 5ah, big lithium batteries quickly. Super handy, small and really portable. I dropped a star, this is wimpy. Low suction, less than the old dustbusters that you hung on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portable vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Takes 20v and 18v batteries which is perfect because I have a ton of them because I use Dewalt tools in my shop. Even has a plug on the unit when I don't have batteries on me. Great for vacuuming my car and other places like my office that is attached to my shop. A+++
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - AC or Battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a DeWalt battery operated shop vac years ago, and it is still going strong. Needed another one for my second home and purchased this model that is AC or DC. These things are super convenient for cleaning up around the shop. Pop in a battery and walk around without the worries and restrictions of a cord. If you don't need to move around, plug her in to an outlet.
customer_reviews.author: mkhatem

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Don't expect it to be a big shop ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Don't expect it to be a big shop vac but it is great for small jobs. Great that it can either plug in or use your tools batteries. Perfect for cleaning out your car for example. Or cleaning up the dust after a small job without having to lug the huge shop vac. Very good suction for something this size. Anyone with a DeWalt cordless tool set should have one of these.
customer_reviews.author: David McCallum

customer_reviews.title: This is the best tool I have purchased in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so handy and portable. No more extension cords and heavy vacs. This has more power on the battery then it does plugged in. Easy to clean and empty. There is another model that does not have the AC cord but do yourself a favor and buy this one, it is worth the extra few bucks
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Works !
customer_reviews.text: Having lots of DeWalt tools and batteries, it was inevitable that I try the vacuum. This thing is very powerful and much easier to carry around than anything I've used before. Car, stairs, inside the computer -- all the places that a regular shop vacuum is awkward to carry or reach. I'm more than pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bugswilson

customer_reviews.title: A great wet-dry vac
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a car vac because it's small and easy to handle. Then I discovered that it's also great for vacuuming the last of the water from my hot tub after it's drained. Haven't used a battery yet, although I have several Dewalt tools that use the same battery. It's really convenient with the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence of PA

customer_reviews.title: Great for the small jobs
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of cordless vacs and this is the best so far. A little bigger than the hand held I was using but quite portable. Lots more suction than the small hand held vac I was using and the battery lasts a lot longer. I charged it a month ago and used it many times and it still has a charge. I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R Ripplinger

customer_reviews.title: We have 4 dogs that shed hair all the time and this works great for picking up those large batches of dog fur ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this corded/cordless vacuum, for our Dogs, We have 4 dogs that shed hair all the time and this works great for picking up those large batches of dog fur that clump up into fur balls, it's so easy to slap in my 18 Volt dewalt from my shop and vacuum the hard faced floors in and around counters, it works so-so on our carpeted floors but it really picks up hair. If you have dogs that shed this is the vacuum for you. The 18 volt battery had enough capacity do do our whole 1,500 sq ft. home although 1/2 is carpeted.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Degraffenreid

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I read previous reviews of knuckleheads who said it was horrible and had no suction. I have no problem with suction. It uses 20v batteries and has a back up power cord. Obviously its more powerful plugged into the wall but its no big loss I'm a carpenter and stone mason. Cleans up all sorts of debris just fine. I'd recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: R Deemer

customer_reviews.title: This Vacuum is loaded with the perfect features. Sadly
customer_reviews.text: This Vacuum is loaded with the perfect features, and the features and setup are awesome. Sadly, it does not back up those features with power. Picks up dust ok, but small pieces of dry wall or leaves on your cars wall board, are not so easy. Yanked up carpet, to put down wood flooring, vacuum could barley pick up the carpet staples.
customer_reviews.author: MikadoWu

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and tough little vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this shopvac for a year and a half now and it is probably the most-used tool in my house. I've used it to suck up huge puddles in my basement, to keep sawdust down when cutting wood, and even just around my house as a tiny little vacuum for places that my standup kenmore vacuum can't reach. it's been totally reliable. The battery life is not amazing but is sufficient for quick jobs around the house/yard/shop.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Borden

customer_reviews.title: It did the job nicely but I didn't really stress it or run the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with the ShopVac 1.25" extension wands (B00002ND41). I used it on AC power to remove about 2" of salt sludge from the bottom of my water softener as part of a cleaning. It handled this job admirably, considering the length of the hose and the extension wands. I've also used it on a 20v battery to clean up some puddles and remove water from a toilet tank. It did the job nicely but I didn't really stress it or run the battery dry. Overall, its a useful little ShopVac if you have realistic expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Nice, portable shop vac, but needs some wands and a battery.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vacuum with one problem.....no wand included for hose, and no battery or charger. Shame on DeWalt for being so cheap!!!! A good price was given, certainly enough to provide a wand!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum is hard to like. The hose is far too short for any practical use. The concept is better than the actual execution. Plus, because it is bagless, it looses suction power very quickly when vacuuming anything like sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: CRPTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Use it everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Did you just drill a hole in the wall for hanging something? How about take a saw to make a quick cut of wood or metal? Do you regularly have Cherrios all over the back seat of your car? The portability of this can't be beat. All those small vacuum jobs that you have to move your shop vac up stairs or outside for can be done by this. The ability to use on battery makes it even more flexible. Clean your car in the driveway without an extension cord. Clean up from drilling holes in drywall anywhere in your home.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: I waited too long to try this out & now I’m 1 day past my return period. I was excited because of the reviews thinking I finally found what I was looking for. The suction...well my home vacuum suctions better than this. It does pick trash up but if your using this to clean out a vehicle then be prepared to spend some time doing it. My only advice on this purchase, use it as soon as you get it to make sure it’s what your looking for. It is small & fairly simple to carry around but it would be nice if it had wheels & a longer suction tube.
customer_reviews.author: ANNIE

customer_reviews.title: Just not very strong
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this vac, except it just does not have the power to pick up much. The only thing that I have found that it works well on is cleaning up after sanding since the mess is light weight, small and dry. Does not do a very good job on carpet or car floor mats. That said, the size is great and I like being able to use either a battery or and outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: That thing sucks!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the complaints about suction, it actually impressed me. The suction is not great but very good regarding the complaints. I’m happy with it so far and hope it doesn’t get the power problems I read about. So far all I can say: it’s a DEWALT!
customer_reviews.author: The German

customer_reviews.title: As portable as a radio.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little thing for being battery powered, might suck a little harder plugged in. Extremely portable, good design, i just wish the exhaust port was in the back or other side. Seems like everytime i go to use it, the exhaust is pointing toward the debree with my first choice of attack. But i love it. Keep in mind, it's tiny, for small areas, smaller diameter hose.
customer_reviews.author: Tom V.

customer_reviews.title: You wont be dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I love this vac when i dont feel like pulling out my 9 gallon this works great and gives me the same results. My favorite things is that its battery and corded I legit went to lowes purchased the brother thats battery only and was like wth why have battery only when i can have the option of being corded.. Im not sure about you but i like having options.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: The run time wasn't horrible on 18V but I recently switched to the newer ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a service technician and I use mine every day. It is just the right size and very convenient because of the battery or cord operation. When I first got it I was using the 18 volt batteries. The run time wasn't horrible on 18V but I recently switched to the newer 20 volt Lithium and it is drastically better! I definitely recommend this tool but make sure you get the one with the cord or battery operation.
customer_reviews.author: vt teacher

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. I now carry it to jobsite for smallish work, avoiding the big, bulky shop vac. I'm impressed/surprised by how well batteries endure. Only 4 stars because ... Wish the exhaust was directed differently.
customer_reviews.author: Yonder

customer_reviews.title: Great for my small messes!
customer_reviews.text: Great accessories I got that fit perfectly: 1. Multi-Fit Wet Dry Vacuum Accessories VT1215 Vacuum Micro Cleaning Kit Vacuum Attachments For Compact Wet Dry Shop Vacuum  2. Shop-Vac 9061400 1.25-Inch Extension Wands
customer_reviews.author: Yumi Koizumi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Use this vac for small clean up. As a maintenance man for a resort this is convenient for cleaning up and small debris such as drywall dust, saw dust and any type of clean-up after servicing guest rooms. I have used this regularly to suck out debri from clogged condensation lines in my fancoils when the pans are overflowing. Sucks like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: This Is a Great Little HEPA Vac
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for everything from grinding concrete, drywall dust, spot cleanups and cars. It is not a heavy duty, high suction vac, but for medium/light duty it is great. I love this when I run it on battery it is super portable and compact enough you can have it next to you without getting in the way.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyG

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt Portable Vacuum Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing this DeWalt portable vacuum cleaner, I've often wondered why it took so long to find this gem! Great suction, ability to use 2 different batteries, & then the wonderful capability to plug this unit into a common 110 vac outlet! For me, it has been the ideal portable vacuum cleaner. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb Portable Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This has exceeded my expectations. I did not need battery as I already have several from other DeWalt tools. I really like the dual power.... battery or electric. Suction is very powerful and of course very portable. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

product_meta.title: DEWALT 18/20V Max Vacuum, Wet/Dry (DCV581H)
product_meta.description: Style:VacuumThe DEWALT DCV581H 18/20v MAX* Cordless/Corded Wet-Dry Vacuum has the ability to provide cordless or corded operation powered by either an 18v or 20v MAX battery or an AC outlet. It features a HEPA rated wet/dry filter that traps dust with 99.97% efficiency at 1 micron. The filter is easily accessible, washable/reusable (use tap or water rinse to clean). This unit has a heavy-duty crush-resistant fully integrated 5' (by 1-1/4" diameter) hose which provides durability, flexibility and ease of use. The on-board hose and accessory storage makes the vacuum easy to carry and transport. Also comes with a crevice tool attachment and a wide nozzle tool attachment. Battery and charger sold separately.
feature_bullets: Can operate corded with an AC outlet, or cordless by an 18v or 20v MAX battery
HEPA Rated filter traps up to 99.97 percent efficiency
Washable/reusable filter;2 Gallon tank capacity. 31 CFM
Crush resistant 5ft hose.Heavy duty, crush resistant, fully integrated 5' (by 1 1/4" diameter) hose provides durability, flexibility and ease of use
On board storage for easy transport.Longest life and best performance can be obtained if the battery pack is charged when the air temperature is between 65°F and 75°F(18°–24°C)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,553 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
